case_vignette: A 6-year-old female with history of atopic dermatitis presents with her mother for evaluation of a rash on the right lower leg. The patient's mom reports the rash developed over the past two weeks and may be growing in size after having a few weeks of cold like symptoms. She denies any new topical products, fragrances, or dyes. She has not tried any treatments. Physical examination is remarkable for multiple pink flat topped scaly papules coalescing into plaques in a curvilinear distribution on the right posterior thigh and calf. Punch biopsy reveals a lymphohistiocytic infiltrate, superficial perivascular inflammation and deeper lymphocytic perieccrine inflammation.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my right lower leg that seems to be growing bigger.
How long have you had the rash for?
The rash developed over the past two weeks.
Have you experienced any other symptoms like fever, joint pain, or swelling around the rash?
I had cold-like symptoms a few weeks ago.
Is the rash itchy, painful, or does it have a burning sensation?
My mom didn't say anything about the rash being itchy, painful, or burning, so I guess it's not bothering me in that way.
Is the rash weepy or crusty, or does it just appear as discolored skin?
The rash has pink flat scaly spots that are joining together on my leg, but my mom didn't mention any weeping or crustiness.
Does the rash blanch when you press on it?
My mom didn't talk about whether the rash changes when you press on it.
Has anyone else in your family had a similar rash or skin condition recently?
No, nobody else in my family has had a similar rash or skin condition recently.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin conditions such as eczema, psoriasis, or allergic reactions?
I have a history of atopic dermatitis.
Are you currently on any medications, including creams or ointments, for atopic dermatitis or any other condition?
No, I haven't tried any treatments.
Have you had any recent insect bites, exposure to plants like poison ivy, or come into contact with any new skincare products?
No, there haven't been any new topical products, fragrances, or dyes, and my mom didn't mention any insect bites or plants like poison ivy.
Final Diagnosis: Nummular eczema (nummular dermatitis)
